items.content:
Company Information
Solid reputation, passionate people and endless opportunities. That's Travelers. Our superior financial strength and consistent record of strong operating returns mean security for our customers - and opportunities for our employees. You will find Travelers to be full of energy and a workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

Job Summary
Under general supervision, demonstrates a thorough understanding of the activities performed related to engineering support, installation and/or operations of infrastructure technologies. Plans at an operational level designing and developing technology solutions interfacing with appropriate customers, management and technical resources. Facilitates and/or participates in the design, development, and implementation of large complex technology solutions supporting one or more business and/or technology areas. Develops and implements appropriate solutions that may involve multiple platforms, databases, software/hardware technologies and tools. Strong ability to multi-task in an environment of changing priorities. This job is a team lead.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
Evaluates systems specifications regarding customer requirements, transforming specifications into cost-effective, technically correct solutions. Prioritizes work and manages projects within established budget objectives and customer priorities. Responsible for establishing and managing to established quality control and security protocols. Provides the division, department and business area management with timely and accurate information regarding the status and performance of the assigned project(s). Leverages technology to develop, redesign and/or implement optimal technology solutions. Builds, leverages, and maintains effective alliances across technical and business community. Interacts with customers to achieve efficient, effective results. Multi-tasks, prioritizes according to business priorities and production availability requirements. Other duties as assigned:
  • Full stack developer/engineer
  • Design, test, develop, deploy, maintain and improve services and systems
  • Deliver high-quality code through hands-on development with attention to detail
  • Analyze and research issues and provide solutions quickly
  • Work closely in an Agile team of product owners and engineers
  • Actively participate in solution design

Minimum Qualifications
High School diploma or equivalent required. 3 years of experience in Technology required.

Education, Work Experience & Knowledge
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field preferred. 5 years of experience in Technology preferred. This is a Back End role : ideally need Go/GoLang
  • 2+ years of Red Hat Enterprise Linux or Ubuntu Linux
  • Proficiency in client-side Javascript and Typescript development
  • Angular or other modern Javascript user interface frameworks experience desirable
  • Experience writing Back End systems and APIs in NodeJS, Go, or Python
  • Hands-on experience working with web services such as REST and data-interchange formats likes JSON
  • Extremely familiar with source code management systems (Git)
  • Unit-testing experience
  • Configuration management experience a plus
  • Docker and container orchestration experience desirable
  • Ambition and desire to learn new technologies and programming languages
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Proven ability to learn and adapt to change quickly and easily

Job Specific & Technical Skills & Competencies
Backend Go/Go Lang - Ideal

Javascript/Typescript
Python
Docker

Environmental/Work Schedules/Other
Weekend work hours, Overnight work hours, Holiday work hours (Federal and religious) - only as needed

Physical Requirements
Operates standard office equipment and Sitting (can stand at will)

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Travelers is an equal opportunity employer.
To apply for this position please CLICK HERE

Company Information
Solid reputation, passionate people and endless opportunities. That's Travelers. Our superior financial strength and consistent record of strong operating returns mean security for our customers - and opportunities for our employees. You will find Travelers to be full of energy and a workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

Job Summary
Under general supervision, demonstrates a thorough understanding of the activities performed related to engineering support, installation and/or operations of infrastructure technologies. Plans at an operational level designing and developing technology solutions interfacing with appropriate customers, management and technical resources. Facilitates and/or participates in the design, development, and implementation of large complex technology solutions supporting one or more business and/or technology areas. Develops and implements appropriate solutions that may involve multiple platforms, databases, software/hardware technologies and tools. Strong ability to multi-task in an environment of changing priorities. This job is a team lead.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
Evaluates systems specifications regarding customer requirements, transforming specifications into cost-effective, technically correct solutions. Prioritizes work and manages projects within established budget objectives and customer priorities. Responsible for establishing and managing to established quality control and security protocols. Provides the division, department and business area management with timely and accurate information regarding the status and performance of the assigned project(s). Leverages technology to develop, redesign and/or implement optimal technology solutions. Builds, leverages, and maintains effective alliances across technical and business community. Interacts with customers to achieve efficient, effective results. Multi-tasks, prioritizes according to business priorities and production availability requirements. Other duties as assigned:
  • Full stack developer/engineer
  • Design, test, develop, deploy, maintain and improve services and systems
  • Deliver high-quality code through hands-on development with attention to detail
  • Analyze and research issues and provide solutions quickly
  • Work closely in an Agile team of product owners and engineers
  • Actively participate in solution design


Minimum Qualifications
High School diploma or equivalent required. 3 years of experience in Technology required.

Education, Work Experience & Knowledge
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field preferred. 5 years of experience in Technology preferred. This is a backend role : ideally need Go/ GoLang
  • 2+ years of Red Hat Enterprise Linux or Ubuntu Linux
  • Proficiency in client-side Javascript and Typescript development
  • Angular or other modern Javascript user interface frameworks experience desirable
  • Experience writing backend systems and APIs in NodeJS, Go, or Python
  • Hands-on experience working with web services such as REST and data-interchange formats likes JSON
  • Extremely familiar with source code management systems (Git)
  • Unit-testing experience
  • Configuration management experience a plus
  • Docker and container orchestration experience desirable
  • Ambition and desire to learn new technologies and programming languages

items.content:
As the Optum Medicaid Management Services (OMMS) Configuration Lead, you will have the opportunity to configure, test, and implement product solutions specific for the Medicaid Fee For Service marketplace. You will configure applications central to the operation of a Claims Submission and Provider Enrollment solution. You will review, interpret, assess, and configure the Optum solution as defined by the operations team to achieve the stated business objectives. Your contributions will directly impact the success of the client implementation. The Configuration Lead will work closely with a team of Product Owners, business analysts, and State SME's to determine system needs and client requirements.This is a challenging role that creates an opportunity to grow and develop while developing and implementing systems that improve State Healthcare programsIf you are located in the MidWest, NorthEast, or SouthEast, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges. Primary Responsibilities:Partner with the business analysts and project leadership to gather, validate, and translate business requirements into technical requirements for the Optum solutionConfigure the Optum solution to meet operation requirements defined by the client needs and requirements and as defined by business analysts Partner with dependent component suppliers to configure their components according to client needs and requirementsSuccessfully configure complex, interdependent solution components resulting in a comprehensive and effective solution for the clientEnsure non-functional requirements are configured as part of the solution (e.g. reliability, availability, security, usability)Identify and alert project leadership to project risks and issues which could impact adherence to project timelines and budget Ensure timely and effective execution of all deliverables Understand business objectives and how technology can optimize and enable solutionsCollaborate with QA team to ensure testing efforts align with functionalityLead and mentor Business System AnalystsPerform other duties as assigned You'll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

Required Qualifications:Bachelor's degree, preferably in Information Management, Information Systems, Computer Science, related field. or equivalent work experience2+ years of Medicaid experience6+ years of business systems analysis experienceExpertise with the ANSI X12 HIPAA transaction setsProficiency with PC based software programs (Excel, Word, Visio, PowerPoint)Experience working with Agile development methodologiesExperience interpreting user stories and applying the appropriate technical solutions to deliver operational resultsAbility to travel up to 75% as neededPreferred Qualifications:4+ years of experience with requirements managementExperience with relational database management systemsExcels in ambiguous work environment, easily adapts to shifting prioritiesAbility to understand and configure technical solutions for complex health care problemsExperience in writing user stories and detailed process flowsExcels at identifying, analyzing, organizing, and solving issues and problemsSelf-starter, resourceful; independently seeks and finds resources, information, knowledge, and/or tools to complete tasks as neededStrong focus on high-quality execution and deliveryStrong oral and written communication skills, clearly presents information, and has good listening skillsComfortable working in and leading a distributed team environment Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)*All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group's Telecommuter PolicyDiversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.Job Keywords: Configuration Lead, MidWest, NorthEast, SouthEast
